comments.author: ben@stechz.com
comments.creator: ben@stechz.com
comments.raw_text:
Currently it is possible to load a frame script and immediately send messages that will not be seen by the TabChild. It would be nice if the message manager could queue these messages until the TabChild is ready.

Once the TabChild is ready, we should be OK. The IPC backend will execute the commands in the order it received them, so the tab child should load a frame script before it sends the messages if done in that order in the parent process.

If you have questions, please contact :mdaly.
